intro: Pilosella adenocephala, commonly known as the woolly cat's ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale yellow ray florets. It thrives in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, often in full sun. Pilosella adenocephala is a perennial herb that is relatively easy to grow in gardens with well-drained soil.
